intro: Gynura divaricata subsp. formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan gynura, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in subtropical regions.
